articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to decide on Monday what levels of tariffs he will impose early on Tuesday on Canada and Mexico amid last-minute negotiations over border security and efforts to halt the inflow of fentanyl opioids.
articles.title: Trump to decide US tariff levels on Mexico, Canada as Tuesday deadline approaches

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli fire killed at least two people in Rafah and injured three others in Khan Younis in the south of Gaza, raising fear among Palestinians that the ceasefire could collapse altogether after Israel imposed a total blockade on the shattered enclave.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills two Palestinians in Gaza amid impasse over ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France and Britain are proposing a partial one-month truce between Russia and Ukraine that would cover air, sea and energy infrastructure attacks but not include ground fighting, French President Emmanuel Macron and his foreign minister said.
articles.title: UK, France propose partial one-month Ukraine truce, Paris says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The incident occurred as crowds gathered in cities across western Germany's Rhineland for parades to mark the carnival season.
articles.title: One dead after car drives into crowd in German city of Mannheim, police say

articles.author: Andrew Mills
articles.description: A plan for Gaza drawn up by Egypt as a counter to U.S. President Donald Trump's ambition for a Middle East Riviera would sideline Hamas and replace it with interim bodies controlled by Arab, Muslim and Western states, according to a draft seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Egypt's alternative to Trump's 'Gaza Riviera' aims to sideline Hamas

articles.author: Erin Banco
articles.description: The United States is drawing up a plan to potentially give Russia sanctions relief as President Donald Trump seeks to restore ties with Moscow and stop the war in Ukraine, a U.S. official and another person familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: White House seeks plan for possible Russia sanctions relief, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels launching an offensive in east Congo abducted at least 130 sick and wounded men from two hospitals in the city of Goma last week, the United Nations said on Monday.
articles.title: East Congo rebels abduct at least 130 hospital patients, UN says

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli troops demolished houses and cleared a wide roadway through the Nur Shams refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, in a weeks-long operation against militant groups that has forced tens of thousands of Palestinians from their homes.
articles.title: Israel clears another refugee camp as squeeze on West Bank tightens

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francissuffered two episodes of "acute respiratory insufficiency" on Monday, the Vatican said, in another setback for the 88-year-old pontiff as he continues to battle double pneumonia.
articles.title: Pope Francis had two episodes of 'acute respiratory insufficiency', Vatican says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pete Marocco, deputy administrator-designate at the U.S. Agency for International Development, will meet with members of Congress on Wednesday to discuss foreign assistance, two sources familiar with the plan said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump administration official to brief Congress on USAID, sources say
